comment: /**  * Extracts records from an iterator and writes them to the memory-mapped file. This method assumes that all values  * in the iterator are of the same type. This method does NOT take care of synchronization. The caller must  * guarantee that the file may be written to before calling this method.  *  * @param input iterator containing records  * @return size of the written buffer  * @throws IOException  */
code: /**  * Extracts records from an iterator and writes them to the memory-mapped file. This method assumes that all values  * in the iterator are of the same type. This method does NOT take care of synchronization. The caller must  * guarantee that the file may be written to before calling this method.  *  * @param input iterator containing records  * @return size of the written buffer  * @throws IOException  */ public int sendBuffer(SingleElementPushBackIterator<IN> input) throws IOException {     if (serializer == null) {         IN value = input.next().         serializer = getSerializer(value).         input.pushBack(value).     }     return sendBuffer(input, serializer). }
